title: Qatar: Driving without a licence could lead to jail, heavy fines, Interior Ministry warns
summary_full: Qatar's Ministry of Interior has issued a stern warning regarding driving without a valid license, emphasizing it's a criminal offense with severe penalties.  Motorists face potential imprisonment from one month to three years and fines ranging from QR10,000 to QR50,000. These strict measures aim to enhance road safety by ensuring only licensed individuals operate vehicles.
